name: EOD Primary Tumor
title: EOD Primary Tumor
notes:
**Note 1:** **Osseous plasmacytomas** 
* Osseous (medullary) plasmacytoma (9731) is a **single**, localized tumor occurring in the bone. 
* There may be soft tissue extension.

**Note 2:** **Extraosseous plasmacytomas** 
* Extraosseous (extramedullary) plasmacytoma (9734) is a **single**, localized tumor that arises in tissue other than bone. 
* The most common sites are the upper respiratory tract, the gastrointestinal tract, lymph nodes, bladder, central nervous system (CNS), breast, thyroid, testis and skin.

**Note 3:** **Lymphoplasmacytic lymphoma** 
* Lymphoplasmacytic lymphoma (9671) and Waldenstrom Macroglobulinemia (9761) are now collected with the plasma cell disorders. These are systemic diseases and should always be coded 700.

**Note 4:** **Multiple plasmacytomas** 
* Per the 2024 WHO Classification of Tumours, Haematolymphoid Tumours, 5th edition, ***a plasmacytoma is defined as a single lesion.*** 
* If there are multiple lesions/plasmacytomas, this is diagnostic of plasma cell myeloma (9732/3) and the Plasma Cell Myeloma Schema should be used to assign EOD.
footnotes:
(1) Fritz AG, Ries LAG (eds). **SEER Extent of Disease 1988: Codes and Coding Instructions (3rd Edition, 1998)**, National Cancer Institute, NIH Pub. No. 98-2313, Bethesda, MD, 1998

(2) Young JL Jr, Roffers SD, Ries LAG, Fritz AG, Hurlbut AA (eds.). **SEER Summary Staging Manual-2000: Codes and Coding Instructions**, National Cancer Institute, NIH Pub. No. 01-4969, Bethesda, MD, 2001.

(3) Collaborative Stage Work Group of the American Joint Committee on Cancer. **Collaborative Stage Data Collection System User Documentation and Coding Instructions, version 02.05**. American Joint Committee on Cancer (Chicago, IL)

(4) Gress, D.M., Edge, S.B., Gershenwald, J.E., et al. **Principles of Cancer Staging**. In: Amin, M.B., Edge, S.B., Greene, F.L., et al. (Eds.) AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 8th Ed. New York: Springer; 2017

(5) **Introduction to Hematologic Malignancies**. In: Amin, M.B., Edge, S.B., Greene, F.L., et al. (Eds.) AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 8th Ed. New York: Springer; 2017

(6) Bergsagel, P.L., Jaffe, E.S., Leonard, J.P., et al. **Plasma Cell Myeloma and Plasma Cell Disorders**. In: Amin, M.B., Edge, S.B., Greene, F.L., et al. (Eds.) AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 8th Ed. New York: Springer; 2017
rows:
Single plasmacytoma occurring in bone (osseous or medullary) (9731)
WITH or WITHOUT soft tissue extension
Single plasmacytoma occurring outside of bone (extraosseous or extramedullary) (9734)

Unknown; extension not stated
Primary tumor cannot be assessed 
Not documented in medical record

Death Certificate Only
